meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: U.S. Lobbies Yugoslavs After opposing President Slobodan Milosevic on the battlefield and in the negotiating room, the Clinton administration is making its case to the voters of Yugoslavia. PAGE A6
U.S. Lobbies Yugoslavs After opposing President Slobodan Milosevic on the battlefield and in the negotiating room, the Clinton administration is making its case to the voters of Yugoslavia. PAGE A6
Operation for Joined Twins Over the objections of the girls' parents, a British court said doctors can separate joined twins, sacrificing one to save the other. PAGE A4
Kraft Recalls Taco Shells Kraft recalled taco shells containing a genetically engineered corn not approved for humans and called for tougher rules on agricultural biotechnology. PAGE C1

French Flight to Baghdad France violated a ban on flights to Iraq by letting a plane of civilians fly to Baghdad, apparently in an effort to force the United Nations to reconsider the sanctions. PAGE A7
U.S. Diplomat Suspended Martin S. Indyk, ambassador to Israel, has been suspended while an investigation determines if he mishandled classified materials. PAGE A3

A Young Man's Violent End Jonathan Burton, 19, was well liked in his Las Vegas neighborhood, but witnesses saw a different, frantic side on the day he went berserk on an airliner and was killed. PAGE A8
